ETYMOLOGY: From Old French gelosie, from gelos (jealous), from Late Latin zelosus, from Greek zelos (zeal, emulation, rivalry).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A feeling of resentment or bitterness towards someone because of their possessions, qualities, or success, or the desire to have them yourself; envy.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 因他人的财产、品质或成功而产生的怨恨或苦涩感，或渴望自己拥有这些东西；嫉妒，羡慕。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Her jealousy of her sister's achievements made her withdrawn and unhappy.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她对姐姐成就的嫉妒使她变得孤僻和不快乐。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A feeling of being protective of one's own rights or possessions, especially in relation to a romantic partner's fidelity; suspicion or fear of rivalry.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种对自身权利或所有物（尤其是在恋爱关系中对伴侣的忠诚）的保护性感觉；怀疑或害怕竞争对手。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: His unfounded jealousy was slowly destroying their marriage.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他毫无根据的嫉妒正在慢慢摧毁他们的婚姻。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Zealous vigilance or anxious care; a feeling of concern for the preservation of something.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 热切的警惕或焦虑的关怀；对某物保存的担忧感。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He showed a great jealousy for the purity of the ancient texts.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他对古籍的纯洁性表现出极大的维护。

REGISTER: Applicable in both formal and informal contexts, depending on the specific nuance being conveyed.
